sampleInfo.name: BrowserSample
sampleInfo.description: This sample demonstrates how to create Browser instance, embed it into Swing BrowserView container, display it in JFrame and navigate to the "www.google.com" web site.

sampleInfo.name: ConsoleListenerSample
sampleInfo.description: The sample demonstrates how to listen to console messages including JavaScript errors.

sampleInfo.name: CookieSample
sampleInfo.description: The sample demonstrates how to access CookieStorage instance to read all the available cookies.

sampleInfo.name: DisposeBrowserSample
sampleInfo.description: This sample demonstrates how to dispose Browser instance. Every Browser instance must be disposed before your Java application exit.

sampleInfo.name: LoginFacebookSample
sampleInfo.description: Demonstrates how to login into Facebook account via login form and DOM API.

sampleInfo.name: JavaScriptDialogsSample
sampleInfo.description: The sample demonstrates how to override default alert dialog. You can register your own DialogHandler where you can implement all the required JavaScript dialogs yourself.

sampleInfo.name: LoadHTMLSample
sampleInfo.description: To load HTML content from a string use Browser.loadHTML() method.

sampleInfo.name: LoadListenerSample
sampleInfo.description: The sample demonstrates how to listen to different load events such as 'start loading frame', 'finish loading frame', 'fail loading frame', 'document loaded in frame' and 'document loaded in main frame'.

sampleInfo.name: JavaScriptSample
sampleInfo.description: Ability to execute JavaScript code on the loaded web page is one of the main features of JxBrowser. To execute JavaScript code, first of all you need to make sure that web page is loaded completely.
